TreeView.jl

  • Readme

    Docstrings
    TreeView.@dag — Macro.

    Make a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) from a Julia expression.

    TreeView.@dag_cse — Macro.

    Perform common subexpression elimination on a Julia Expression, and make a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) of the result.

    TreeView.@tree — Macro.

    Make a tree from a Julia Expression. Omits call.

    TreeView.@tree_with_call — Macro.

    Make a tree from a Julia Expression. Includes call.

    TreeView.DirectedAcyclicGraph — Type.

    Structure representing a DAG. Maintains a symbol_map giving the currently-known symbols and the corresponding vertex number in the graph.

    TreeView.LabelledDiGraph
    TreeView.LabelledTree
    TreeView.TreeView
    TreeView.add_numbered_vertex!
    TreeView.add_symbol! — Function.

    Adds a symbol to the DAG if it doesn't already exist. Returns the vertex number

    Make numbers unique:

    TreeView.latex_label — Function.

    Convert a symbol or into a LaTeX label

    TreeView.lookup! — Function.

    Look up a symbol to see if it has already been seen.

    TreeView.make_dag — Function.

    Make a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) from a Julia expression.

    TreeView.make_dag! — Function.

    Update a Directed Acyclic Graph with the result of traversing the given Expression.

    TreeView.tikz_representation — Function.

    Return a Tikz representation of a tree object. The tree object must have fields g (the graph) and labels.

    TreeView.walk_tree
    TreeView.walk_tree! — Function.
    walk_tree!(g, labels, ex, show_call=true)

    Walk the abstract syntax tree (AST) of the given expression ex. Builds up the graph g and the set of labels for each node, both modified in place

    show_call specifies whether to include call nodes in the graph. Including them represents the Julia AST more precisely, but adds visual noise.

    Returns the number of the top vertex.
